trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby with TinyTDS on Mac OS X (Yosemite)
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby with TinyTDS on Mac OS X (Yosemite)

trans-unit.source: Give a Ruby code sample you can run on Mac OS X (Yosemite) to connect to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Give a Ruby code sample you can run on Mac OS X (Yosemite) to connect to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This topic presents a Ruby code sample that runs on Mac computer running Yosemite to connect to an Azure SQL Database database.
trans-unit.target: This topic presents a Ruby code sample that runs on Mac computer running Yosemite to connect to an Azure SQL Database database.

trans-unit.source: Open your terminal and install the following:
trans-unit.target: Open your terminal and install the following:

trans-unit.source: 1) Homebrew: Run the following command from your terminal.
trans-unit.target: 1) Homebrew: Run the following command from your terminal.

trans-unit.source: This will download the Homebrew package manager on your machine.
trans-unit.target: This will download the Homebrew package manager on your machine.

trans-unit.source: 2) FreeTDS: Run the following command from your terminal.
trans-unit.target: 2) FreeTDS: Run the following command from your terminal.

trans-unit.source: This will install FreeTDS on your machine and is required for TinyTDS to work.
trans-unit.target: This will install FreeTDS on your machine and is required for TinyTDS to work.

trans-unit.source: 3) TinyTDS: Run the following command from your terminal.
trans-unit.target: 3) TinyTDS: Run the following command from your terminal.

trans-unit.source: This will install TinyTDS on your machine.
trans-unit.target: This will install TinyTDS on your machine.

trans-unit.source: The Ruby sample relies on the AdventureWorks sample database.
trans-unit.target: The Ruby sample relies on the AdventureWorks sample database.

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have AdventureWorks, you can see how to create it at the following topic: <linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have AdventureWorks, you can see how to create it at the following topic: <linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The topic also explains how to retrieve the database connection string.
trans-unit.target: The topic also explains how to retrieve the database connection string.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>TinyTDS::Client</linkText><title></title> function is used to connect to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>TinyTDS::Client</linkText><title></title> function is used to connect to SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>TinyTds::Result</linkText><title></title> function is used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>TinyTds::Result</linkText><title></title> function is used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This function accepts a query and returns a result set.
trans-unit.target: This function accepts a query and returns a result set.

trans-unit.source: The results set is iterated over by using <linkText>result.each do |row|</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The results set is iterated over by using <linkText>result.each do |row|</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The code sample:
trans-unit.target: The code sample:

trans-unit.source: Passes parameters for values to be inserted in a row.
trans-unit.target: Passes parameters for values to be inserted in a row.

trans-unit.source: Inserts the row.
trans-unit.target: Inserts the row.

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the value that was generated for the primary key.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves the value that was generated for the primary key.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Database, the <linkText>IDENTITY</linkText><title></title> property and the <linkText>SEQUENCE</linkText><title></title> object can be used to auto-generate <linkText>primary key values</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Database, the <linkText>IDENTITY</linkText><title></title> property and the <linkText>SEQUENCE</linkText><title></title> object can be used to auto-generate <linkText>primary key values</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To use TinyTDS with Azure, it is recommended that you execute several SET statements to change how the current session handles specific information.
trans-unit.target: To use TinyTDS with Azure, it is recommended that you execute several SET statements to change how the current session handles specific information.

trans-unit.source: Recommended SET statements are provided in the code sample.
trans-unit.target: Recommended SET statements are provided in the code sample.

trans-unit.source: For example, SET ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON will allow new columns created to allow null values even if the nullability status of the column is not explicitly stated.
trans-unit.target: For example, SET ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON will allow new columns created to allow null values even if the nullability status of the column is not explicitly stated.

trans-unit.source: To align with the Microsoft SQL Server <linkText>datetime</linkText><title></title> format, use the <linkText>strftime</linkText><title></title> function to cast to the corresponding datetime format.
trans-unit.target: To align with the Microsoft SQL Server <linkText>datetime</linkText><title></title> format, use the <linkText>strftime</linkText><title></title> function to cast to the corresponding datetime format.
